answers.answer: Have you looked into testing Vitamin D and B12 levels and diabetes?

Hello~Have you been tested for diabetes? That was the first thought that came to my mind as diabetes can have these symptoms. I would certainly ask your doctor for the test, it is a simple blood draw, and I understand now, they do the A1c test as this is very accurate as it tells how much sugar the cells have been absorbing in a 3 month period.

question: I have had Fibromyalgia for 22yrs,Spongilitis , Scoliosis, and Arthritis also. I have tremors, numb toes both feet, nerve tingling across my shoulders, my arms are sore, going numb as is my face and the back of my head. I.m tired, thirsty. my eye sight has changed twice in a year. I am worried that I have M. S. Nobody wants to listen to me, what do I do?
title: Am I going bonkers
